title: About
text:
This site was created for my Quantitative Analysis Class, ESS-330, at CSU using Quarto and serves as an introduction to who I am and some of the skills I have acquired through my professional, academic, and personal life.



Hiking Vinciguerra Glacier near Ushuaia, Argentina

title: Alex Smilor
text:
Hi, my name is Alex Smilor.
I am studying Ecosystem Science at Colorado State University, with a particular interest in avian and forest ecology as that relates to climate and anthropogenic change. I have worked extensively with field methods used in bird and forest monitoring research, ranging from point count surveys of passerines in New Mexico to extensive forest inventory surveys for climate adaptation research projects in Colorado. Additionally, while studying abroad in Ushuaia, Argentina I conducted an independent research project studying how climate change and warming spring temperatures affected the breeding phenology of a small Gentoo Penguin colony.
Beyond this, I love to spend my time outdoors, especially hiking, skiing, biking, and camping. I also spend an arguably excessive amount of time birdwatching in areas around the country and have slowly accumulated a life list exceeding 450 species in the US. I also love to take my many opportunities outside to take images of all of the nature around me, especially birds. Lastly, I participate in a number of citizen science initiatives, including eBird, Christmas Bird Counts, and iNaturalist.

title: Resume
text:
Education







Bachelor of Science in Ecosystem Science and Sustainability
Minor in Spanish
Colorado State University, Fort Collins, Colorado
May 2025
GPA: 3.99







Work Experience



Field and Lab Technician
Ward Lab of Ornithology; University of Illinois

Mistnet, extract, and band migratory passerine birds.
Assist with maintaining and repairing the Illinois MOTUS network, including constructing antennas and sensorgnomes, and repairing MOTUS towers.
Clean, manage and analyze MOTUS data to contribute to research publications.

September 2025 - Present


Kirtland’s Warbler Radio Telemetry Team Lead
Smithsonian Migratory Bird Center

Plan daily tasks for 1-3 field technicians, manage equipment, and teach field technicians protocols and use of radio telemetry equipment.
Monitor males to determine their pairing status by observing breeding behaviors.
Operate and download data from MOTUS towers. Also set up electronics used in the towers.
Use telemetry to track birds to map territories with a Trimble field GPS and record their song rate.
Follow safe nest searching protocols to locate nests to assist a nest searching effort.
Help with setting up mist nets, recording banding data, handling and releasing birds safely, and activating Nanotags.
Check and manage data for multiple projects, serving as the principal data checker.

May 2025 – August 2025


Student Lab Assistant
Colorado Forest Restoration Institute

Developed a communications project and database to visually demonstrate how Colorado forests change over time in response to various treatments.
Updated CFRI’s website using Wordpress software to improve the front-end user experience.

August 2024 – May 2025


Subalpine Forest Monitoring Field Technician
Colorado Forest Restoration Institute

Used stem mapping procedures using a variable radius plot protocol.
Identified and measured the height and diameter at breast height (DBH) of trees.
Cored and aged trees.
Conducted simple vegetation sampling in quadrats.
Identified common herbaceous and shrubby plant species.
Used forestry tools including calipers, densiometers, DBH tapes, and rangefinders.

June 2024 – August 2024


Independent Study Project
School for International Training

Designed and executed an independent research project examining the effects of climate on the breeding phenology and demography of Gentoo Penguins.
Collected phenological and demographic data from camera trap images.
Conducted a literature review and developed hypotheses.
Used R and RStudio to analyze data, develop and compare models, and generate visualizations.
Presented the project in a 16-page report written in Spanish and in a Spanish-language presentation.
Link to report:https://drive.google.com/file/d/1rGPQembxepKrLT7sDl87VDYBCqSeA0ip/view?usp=sharing




Undergrad Research Assistant
Colorado Forest Restoration Institute

Managed data for a research project, including entering data into Excel and checking data quality.
Entered data, managed data, checked data quality, and communicated about issues.

August 2023 – December 2023


Subalpine Forest Monitoring Field Technician
Colorado Forest Restoration Institute

Assessed tree survivorship and growth to monitor forest recovery from bark beetle outbreaks.
Counted and identified seedlings and trees.
Sampled coarse fuels load in a plot.
Measured litter and duff depth.
Sampled for snowshoe hare scat as a part of a lynx monitoring effort.
Used forestry tools including calipers, densiometers, DBH tapes, and clinometers.

July 2023 – August 2023


Fire Ecology Field Technician
Department of Forest and Rangeland Stewardship at CSU

Conducted avian point count surveys to evaluate avian species richness.
Assessed forest composition to determine fire’s effect on bird populations.
Identified over 60 species of Rocky Mountain bird species by sight and sound.
Camped for up to 8 days consecutively and hiked up to six miles daily.

May 2023 – June 2023





Volunteer Experience







Wildlife Monitoring Volunteer
The Wildlife Society at CSU & Colorado Parks and Wildlife

Surveyed and identified raptors with a group using point count techniques.
Taught other volunteers how to identify raptors and use field equipment including spotting scopes.
Annually surveyed bighorn sheep populations systematically to estimate local populations.

August 2021 – December 2023


Owl Monitoring Volunteer
Bird Conservancy of the Rockies & Ornithology Club at CSU

Performed nocturnal playback surveys for Eastern Screech-Owls in riparian woodland to assess owl presence with other volunteers.

March 2023 - May 2023





Skills






Language: English (native speaker), Spanish (working proficiency)


Computer Software: RStudio, ArcGIS Pro, QGIS, Adobe Lightroom and Photoshop


Fieldwork: VHF radio telemetry, point count bird surveys, bird band resighting, target mist netting, some bird banding, tree coring, forest inventory sampling, fuel load sampling, simple quadrat vegetation surveys, scat surveys, spotting scope, hiking rugged uphill terrain carrying 50+ lbs, driving 4WD vehicle on backcountry roads, power and hand tool use, soldering


Personal: birding, digital photography, camping, casual plant identification, creative writing





Publications



TropiRoot 1.0: Database of Tropical Root Characteristics across Environments
Cordeiro, Amanda L., Daniela F. Cusack, Nathaly Guerrero-Ramírez, Richard J. Norby, Laura Toro, Michelle Y. Wong, S. Joseph Wright… Alex W. Smilor, et al. 2025. “TropiRoot 1.0: Database of Tropical Root Characteristics across Environments.” Ecology 106(5): e70074.https://doi.org/10.1002/ecy.70074
2025
